(cont'd)

"... The cases looked at here are important, therefore, in that they indicate just how tricky, uncertain, and byzantine a business scientific discovery can actually be. Contrary to the traditional view, this critical stage is mediated by a wide range of social and psychological factors that all too easily tempt researchers from the path of righteousness laid down by the rules of the scientific method as conventionally defined. During the verification stage, the prognosis for bad ideas supported by good PR is extremely poor. But when new territory is being opened up, there is far more scope for tactical skills and sheer force of personality to play decisive parts."
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - Scientific Discovery is Impossible Without Faith in Ideas Which are of a Purely Speculative Kind - 3
